But it seems like it's always orange. Fair point. The last time the threat level was a different color-- 2006-- Michael Vick was still the starting quarterback for the Falcons, Shirley Franklin was mayor of Atlanta and Dunwoody wasn't a city.

What Yahoo is to Bing, Nokia is to Windows Phone 7. "The game has changed from a war of devices to a war of ecosystems," said Nokia CEO Stephen Elop at his press conference. We have an opportunity to disrupt the trajectory in the mobile ecosystem. Together we will deliver great mobile products. Steve Ballmer said Microsoft and Nokia "can work together in a different kind of a way." Nokia and Microsoft engineers will collaborate. While Eric Schmidt travels the world meeting with business partners, government officials and potential takeover targets, Page says he will be making most of the big decisions as he tries to rekindle the soul and passion of a startup. Sergey Brin will concentrate on developing new products. He's worth$ 15 billion, but Page remains something of a rebel who has always had a disdain for corporate protocol.

The announcement arrived only minutes before the search giant's first earnings call of 2011-- and boy oh boy, the executive shakeup had nothing to do with earnings. We've had a very strong quarter, said Eric Schmidt , referencing the company's revenues of$ 8.44 billion, up 26% year-over-year. Eric Schmidt has been CEO for nearly a decade.
